7063244:
BRONCHOSCOPY NOTE - URGENT
Date: [REDACTED]
Patient: [REDACTED] | MRN: [REDACTED] | Age: 3 years, Male
Attending: Dr. Patricia Lee, MD (Pediatric IP)
Location: [REDACTED]

INDICATION: 3-year-old male with witnessed aspiration of peanut 2 hours ago. Stridor, decreased breath sounds on right.

PROCEDURE: Rigid bronchoscopy with foreign body removal

ANESTHESIA: General anesthesia (sevoflurane induction, propofol maintenance)

FINDINGS:
- Vocal cords: Edematous
- Trachea: Mucosal inflammation
- Right mainstem: Peanut fragment lodged at RMS/BI junction causing complete obstruction
- Left lung: Normal

PROCEDURE: Using 3.5mm pediatric rigid bronchoscope, the peanut was visualized. Optical forceps used to grasp and remove the foreign body en bloc. Post-removal inspection showed mucosal edema and erythema but patent airway. Second fragment found in RLL, also removed.

SPECIMENS: Peanut fragments x 2 (gross specimen)

COMPLICATIONS: None

POST-PROCEDURE: Dexamethasone 0.5mg/kg IV given. Patient extubated, stridor resolved. Admission for overnight observation and racemic epinephrine PRN.

Dr. Patricia Lee, MD
